description: HTML is a markup language that structures the content of web pages. It defines elements like headings, paragraphs, and links, and provides the basic framework for web design.
CSS styles the visual presentation of web pages. It controls layout, colors, fonts, and spacing, working alongside HTML and JavaScript to enhance design and user experience.
JavaScript is a language that makes websites interactive and dynamic. It runs in browsers and can also be used on servers. It works with HTML and CSS.
TypeScript is a statically typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript, providing enhanced tooling and error-checking capabilities.
Node.js is a runtime that lets you run JavaScript on the server side. Itâ€™s designed for building fast, scalable network applications using a non-blocking, event-driven model.
React is a library for building user interfaces. It allows you to create interactive and dynamic web apps using reusable components. It focuses on efficient updates and rendering.
Angular is a framework for building web apps. It helps create dynamic user interfaces using TypeScript and provides tools for data management, routing, and forms.
Python is an interpreted, high-level programming language with dynamic semantics, known for its readability and versatility.
GitHub is a platform for version control and collaboration. It hosts code repositories, tracks changes, and facilitates team collaboration on software projects using Git.
